trigger: Evidence for a polyclonal etiology of palmar fibromatosis .

X chromosome inactivation patterns at the <extra_id_0> androgen receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> locus were evaluated to determine clonality in microdissected lesional tissue and in leukocytes from 2 women with Dupuytren 's disease .
The tissue from both patients generated a polyclonal pattern of X chromosome inactivation of the human <extra_id_0> androgen receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .
This finding supports a polyclonal reactive process as the underlying etiology for palmar fibromatosis .
